question: Which regulator body has launched Faceless Income Tax Appeals?
explanation:
The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has launched Faceless Income Tax Appeals. Under this new regime, all income tax assessments including e-allocation of appeals, e-communication of notices, e-verification, e-enquiry and e-hearing will be held online.
But, serious frauds, major tax evasion, International taxation and Black Money are exempted. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, on 13th August 2020 launched the Faceless Assessment and Taxpayers’ Charter as part of the “Transparent Taxation - Honoring the Honest” platform.
